results.title: A Writer-Director-Star Breaks Through. It Only Took a Lifetime.
results.abstract: Radha Blank spent years trying to impress the theater world. Now, her Sundance hit, “The Forty-Year-Old Version,” is proof that dreams don’t expire.

results.title: Need an Essential Chronicler of America? Try This Nonfiction Master
results.abstract: Frederick Wiseman captures life unfolding within institutions. If that sounds boring, the riveting “Public Housing” shows why his work is anything but.

With No New Films, Regal Cinemas Shuts Down Again
results.abstract: Cineworld, the parent company of the second largest chain in the U.S., is closing all its theaters in the country, as studios keep postponing releases and audiences remain reluctant to return to the movies.

results.abstract: She was the first in Puerto Rico to change a gender designation on a birth certificate and the first there to reveal that she’d had sex-reassignment surgery.
results.title: Soraya Santiago Solla, Transgender Trailblazer, Dies at 72
